modelelement.name: sdmetricsbase
modelelement.attribute: Owner of the element in the UML model.
Unique identifier of the model element.
Name of the element in UML model.
The comments for the model element.

modelelement.name: class
modelelement.attribute: Visibility of the element (public, protected, package, private).
Boolean indicating if the element is abstract.
Boolean indicating if the element can have specializations.
The attributes of the element.
The operations of the element.
The nested classifiers of the element.
The generalizations owned by the element.
The interface realizations owned by the element.
The connectors owned by the element.

modelelement.name: interface
modelelement.attribute: The attributes of the interface.
The operations of the interface.
The nested classifiers of the interface.
The generalizations owned by the interface.

modelelement.name: datatype
modelelement.attribute: The attributes of the element.
The operations of the element.
The generalizations owned by the element.

modelelement.name: enumeration
modelelement.attribute: The literals of the enumeration.

modelelement.name: connector
modelelement.attribute: The connector ends of the connector.

modelelement.name: connectorend
modelelement.attribute: The element that is attached at this connector end.

modelelement.name: property
modelelement.attribute: Visibility of the feature (public, private, protected, package).
Reference to the feature type (class, data type etc).
Changeability of the feature. Values: true, false (default if not specified).
Reference to association if this is an association end.
The aggregation kind of the property: shared, composite, or none (default).
The qualifier attributes of the property.

modelelement.name: operation
modelelement.attribute: Visibility of the operation (public, private, protected, package).
Boolean indicating if operation is abstract.
Boolean indicating if operation is a query that does not change the classifier's state.
The parameters of the operation.

modelelement.name: parameter
modelelement.attribute: The direction of the parameter: in (default), out, inout, return.
Reference to the parameter type (class, data type etc).

modelelement.name: package
modelelement.attribute: The owned member elements.

modelelement.name: association
modelelement.attribute: The member ends of the association.
The owned ends of the association (not navigable association ends).
The generalizations owned by the association.

modelelement.name: generalization
modelelement.attribute: Link to the parent in the generalization.

modelelement.name: interfacerealization
modelelement.attribute: Link to the realized interface.

modelelement.name: sdmetricsabstractrelation
modelelement.attribute: Links to the supplier elements of the relationship.
Links to the client elements of the relationship.

modelelement.name: collaboration
modelelement.attribute: Behavior specifications owned by the collaboration.

modelelement.name: interaction
modelelement.attribute: The lifelines involved in the interaction.
The messages sent within the interaction.
The message occurrence specifications and combined fragments of the interaction.

modelelement.name: instancespecification
modelelement.attribute: Links to the classifiers that this entity is an instance of.
The deployments where this instance specification is the target.

modelelement.name: lifeline
modelelement.attribute: The interaction participant that this lifeline represents.

modelelement.name: message
modelelement.attribute: Occurrence specification for the message reception.
Occurrence specification for the message sending.
The sort of communication (synchCall, asynchCall, asynchSignal).

modelelement.name: occurrencespec
modelelement.attribute: The lifeline on which this occurrence specification appears.
The occurring event.

modelelement.name: combinedfragment
modelelement.attribute: The interaction operator (alt, loop, break, opt, par, ref, etc.)
The lifelines covered by this combined fragment.
The interaction operands of this combined fragment.

modelelement.name: interactionoperand
modelelement.attribute: The message occurrence specifications and combined fragments of the interaction operand.

modelelement.name: usecase
modelelement.attribute: The include relationships owned by the use case.
The extend relationships owned by the use case.
The extension points owned by the use case.

modelelement.name: usecaseextend
modelelement.attribute: The use case that is extended.
The extension point in the extended use case.

modelelement.name: usecaseinclude
modelelement.attribute: The included use case.

modelelement.name: statemachine
modelelement.attribute: The top-level regions owned by the state machine.
Boolean indicating if this is a protocol state machine
The connection points of the state machine.

modelelement.name: region
modelelement.attribute: The states contained in the region.
The transitions contained in the region.

modelelement.name: state
modelelement.attribute: The kind of state: '' (empty), final, initial, deepHistory, shallowHistory, join, fork, choice, junction, entryPoint, exitPoint, terminate.
The regions of the composite or concurrent state.
The entry activities of the state.
The exit activities of the state.
The do-activities of the state.
The connection points of the state.

modelelement.name: transition
modelelement.attribute: The kind of transition: external, internal, or local.
Boolean indicating if this is a protocol transition.
The source state of the transition.
The target state of the transition.
The triggers that may fire the transition.
The guard of the transition.
The activity to be performed when the transition fires.

modelelement.name: trigger
modelelement.attribute: The event causing the trigger.

modelelement.name: event
modelelement.attribute: The kind of event (signal, call, change, time, anyreceive).
The element (signal, operation, boolean expression, or deadline) that raised the event, if any.

modelelement.name: activity
modelelement.attribute: The action, control, and object nodes of the activity.
The control and object flows of the activity.
The groups of the activity.

modelelement.name: sdmetricsabstractactivitygroup
modelelement.attribute: The contained edges of the group.
The contained nodes of the group.
The subgroups of the group.
The exception handlers of the structured node group.
Pins owned by the activity group.

modelelement.name: activitygroup
modelelement.attribute: The kind of group: partition, interruptible, expansion, structured, conditional, loop, sequence.

modelelement.name: sdmetricsabstractaction
modelelement.attribute: The kind of action: send, return, create, etc (there are many).
The input pins of the action.
The output pins of the action.
The exception handlers owned by the action.

modelelement.name: controlnode
modelelement.attribute: The kind of control node: initial, activityfinal, flowfinal, fork, join, merge, or decision.

modelelement.name: objectnode
modelelement.attribute: The kind of object node: centralbuffer, datastore, activityparameter, or expansion.

modelelement.name: pin
modelelement.attribute: The kind of pin (input, output, value, actioninput).
The type of the pin.

modelelement.name: controlflow
modelelement.attribute: Source of the control flow.
Target of the control flow.
Guard of the control flow.

modelelement.name: objectflow
modelelement.attribute: Source of the object flow.
Target of the object flow.
Guard of the control flow.

modelelement.name: exceptionhandler
modelelement.attribute: The node that handles the exception.
The input node of the handler body that received the exception token.

modelelement.name: component
modelelement.attribute: The realizations owned by the component.
Other members owned by the component.

modelelement.name: node
modelelement.attribute: The subnodes located on the node.
The deployment links owned by the node (=deployment location).
The type of node (regular, executionenvironment, device)

modelelement.name: artifact
modelelement.attribute: The artifacts that are defined (nested) within the artifact.
The manifestation links to the model elements that are manifested in the artifact.

modelelement.name: deployment
modelelement.attribute: The deployment specifications that parameterize the deployment.

modelelement.name: comment
modelelement.attribute: The comment text.

modelelement.name: diagram
modelelement.attribute: The type of diagram (class diagram, sequence diagram, etc).

modelelement.name: diagramelement
modelelement.attribute: The element that is shown on the diagram.
